description: From Ancient Greek μέλισμα (mélisma, “song”), from μελίζω (melízō, “(I) sing, modulate; (I) celebrate in song”), from μέλος (mélos, “song, tune, melody; limb, part; member”).

nouns.description: melisma (countable and uncountable, plural melismas or melismata)

entries.meaning: (music, countable) A passage of several notes sung to one syllable of text.
examples: A choir sang one of the Lamentations of Jeremiah. The mournful melisma accompanied the slow procession to the palace built by Herod the Great, at present untenanted.

entries.meaning: (music, uncountable) The use of such passages.
